comments.body: This... needs.. to be... a THING!

Yes, it is a great idea (that probably wouldn't need much effort on the side of developers to work). Playing on a controller is so slow. Although playstation releasing a key-binding program would solve this problem for ALL games.

i was scouring the internet looking for this and i came to find out it is not a thing about 3 weeks ago :( been waiting to see if theres a change but nothing yet, please bring this to consoles bc oml, i would not leave my room if it was a thing xD

So let me get this straight. Minecraft supports k&m on Xbox AND mobile. But Playstation seems to be the only thing mojang doesn't care about. Now It could be possible that they are working on it. But this forum seems a bit old. I highly agree that k&m should be compatible on ps4 minecraft. I doubt that mojang is still working on it a whole year later from this forum. But I mean, come on already the people want k&m compatibility for ps4 and the people who don't care about It can stay with controllers. Again, I hope they are still working on it or are starting to work on it. PLEASE make it compatible already you would get so many more people playing it and finding friends on these new mini games. Please just add it already. It's much needed and greatly valued. 

 

EDIT: so i read somewhere that mojang offered to release the compatability to Sony but Sony declined. Basically means that ps4 will never see keyboard and mouse function. So a strong suggestion for  everyone who wants to play  keyboard and mouse on ps4. You should leave a response on a Sony feedback page. It is there fault we can't play with keyboard and mouse. For some reason they want to be stingy like that :(

yesss pleasee!
stillllllll waiting on it! It’s actually so annoying playing with controller on minecraft doesn’t feel natural

I have been playing with a k&m for several days now on PS4 Minecraft. It seems to only be available for 1st player but it works as long as you start the game with it.

I tried to get it to work for player 2, 3, and 4 on split screen but no luck. The keyboard and mouse will connect to the user in the ps4 system but Minecraft doesn't appear to recognize it for that player reliably(I one time was able to get the mouse to work for player 2, then another time the keyboard, but never together and not without a ps4 controller also connected to that player).

Multiple keyboard and mouse or support for 2nd, 3rd, and 4th players would be great.

Although I'm pretty sure, based on the amount of split screen related bugs we find, that playing multi player on one console isn't all that common.
In the Bedrock edition there is support with keyboard and mouse.
It needs to be a thing

Really useful for Realms Worlds! In fact automatically generate a folder for the worlds to reside in named after the realm so you can just hop straight into your Realms world playlist! Maybe have an Indent and + "folder name" name with a plus button so you can open a folder like:

       - Folder

      |-   World 3

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Absolutely Genius!! Definitely needed in the game! Voted!!!!!
what about Java?

I'm surprised the game doesn't already have some sort of searching system for when you have many worlds.

I'm mainly referring to the Java Edition, because I tend to like having mods enabled on some worlds and then leave some vanilla. Sorting which is modded and which is vanilla would make finding the right world much easier.

I was going to suggest this and its a great idea! I have different worlds that are similar to each other (like build themes) and I would like to sort them into folders so I can find them easily. It would be nice if this happened in 1.16.2 or something like that.

I would love this as a feature, it is very much needed! Especially on bedrock edition on Xbox One because there is no way to access game files. We need an in-game way of organising our worlds! I'd love to see folders or they could add a tag and filter system EG you could filter to just show the worlds that you have manually tagged as "creative" and "minigame".

398037345891 I don't know what version you're on, but on Java edition you already can search. There's a search bar on the top. (Although it's kind of hit-or-miss if it works right depending on the version. :P)
Must have it. You are getting my vote!

There would be a button on the right side of the "Edit World" button. It would have a folder on it. Then click the folder you want to put the world in(or make a new one) and TADA! a world in a folder!

To open the folder, Click the folder button that is on the right of the "Create New World" button, then choose a folder, then BAM! it will only show worlds from that folder!
For the love of god, add this. I'm begging you Mojang

I love this idea, no longer would I have to delete or remove worlds from the Minecraft files because it's getting way too messy.

Minecraft really needs an update focusing mostly on improving the overall experience of things outside gameplay like the suggestion above and a better server system for example.
I have the exact same idea and I made a post just like this from what I see I hope this gets added
This is a great idea!
This is a great idea. My worlds are all getting cluttered up. If there was a way to do this I would be very happy.

This is exactly what I was going to say!

And I must say that this is an excellent idea and I hope that Mojang takes this into consideration.
Just had this idea as I was checking out seeds from chunkbase. I'd like to be able to tell which worlds I shouldn't "delete forever!" but as of now I just delete the ones named "New World"
I also have a large list of worlds, so this would be very helpful!

What bedrock really needs is PER WORLD advancements. Many folks want to run modded realms and worlds, which disables xbox live achievements. Allowing PER WORLD advancements would allow realm and world owners to allow players to still advance in the world, and perhaps even open the door to custom advancements.

Achievements as nice as they can be... are only useful once since they are global to all worlds that account plays on.
I agree with someone saying to add minecoins or a new currency called tickets to award you when you complete an achievement, but they should be balanced and not way overpowered.

I like it but we need world achivement like Java with the same achievement, and maybe keep this like a account achivement that can be added to Java with most difficult achivement like mine a million blocks or walk 1 millón block or have every block posible in survival.

I recommend supporting offline achievements.

You don't have to show the word "reward."
i really want the new achievement screen, i approve !!

it should not be linked to the xbox account but it should be part of the game and can be achieved and even told when we complete the achievement. we can get the G points later, but we should get the achievement as soon as we do it, even offline. with the recent update, we would get achievements when you get online later, but instead let us get it ingame even when offline, but we could get the G points when we get online later
I honestly would love the idea of the Java achievement system in Bedrock. Though I, and I think everyone else would like to know how you become one of those selected few who are chosen to test it
I want achievements to be like in Java

It should be like in java, that the achievements can be completed again when creating other worlds and to be able to unlock more things for the character creator by completing other achievements in the future.
You should have different achievements with world and xbox account so that you can see your own progress with the behaviour packs you installed
Make it a notification that pops up in game
Make the achievements something that resets per world like java
I want global success like java. This feature should be available in Bedrock. I want the achievementment Java feature you should add to Bedrock.

Achievements need to be cross platform for PS4 and soon PS5 users with PSN accounts linked with MS Accounts. Also unlockable emotes and items on Android/Xbox versions need to be brought into parity on PS4 platform to make Bedrock unified content on all platforms and to help prevent PS4 game crashes and/or failure to load character using an item from Android unlocked by achievements that do not exist or are a pay for item on PS4 for the same game platform. PS4 Bedrock is missing 4 emotes that are achievement unlocked on Android, and when character is equiped on Android with one of these emotes, when character is loaded on PS4, the game will crash because these emotes do not exist on the PS4 Bedrock edition. Clothing items will not achievement unlock on PS4 where on Android they can, many like my have Platinum'd (collected all trophies) for Bedrock Edition and PS4 Edition Minecraft, but those achievements/trophies are not updated on Microsoft Achievements even though PSN accounts are linked to MS Minecraft accounts.

These issues need to be fixed as 1) game breaking, 2) unfair to PS4 users, 3) Achievements done are not given credit when performed on PS4 with MS linked account, MS doesn't recognize achievement done, or in my case, all achievements done.4)Items and Emotes need to be in parity on all platforms operating the same exact game, namely Minecraft Bedrock, so all users have access to everything that is available on other devices, aka clothes/emotes missing on PS4.
O minecraft poderia ter um sistema de magias

Mojang, launch the new achievements screen Minecraft bedrock edition in the next official version.
🙏🙏🙏🙏

I wanted specific achievements to remain in the world itself but if you acquire another new achievement it would eventually apply to your Xbox Live account (Edit: And each achievement acquired in a world would give you some XP points, but depending on the rarity / difficulty to acquire the achievement, the more XP you will acquire as well) (Edit 2: There would also be a new villager who would be similar to the wanderer merchant but, instead of exchanging emerald for something, you would exchange your XP points for something) (Edit 3: Also when acquiring a new achievement, in addition to being applied in your world and in your account, you will earn an XP bonus in your world) (Edit 6: You could have new rewards for acquiring an achievement (Ex .: When you fish you get fishing pants). And another thing that although it is not very related to the achievements but in any case is a suggestion. My other suggestion is that depending on your outfit that you acquired in an achievement, you would get a bonus or boost when doing a certain action (Ex .: When you conquer an achievement of wearing 30 emeralds with a villager you get a green outfit and with that outfit on you have a slight "Hero of the Village" effect or you would get a bonus when making a trade with a villager). Although it is advantageous, it would be nice to have this feature.)
You guys should add offline achievements because some people only really play offline and don’t earn achievements that much.
Depois de ganhar algumas conquistas, poder ganhar  umas skin personalizada pra o Xbox seria bacana.

First off, thanks for giving me a chance to try out the new Achievement UI design! :D

My opinion is: I like the new style, it is more optimized for any input (either touch, mouse, and even controller). And now it's properly ordered. I also like that I can see details of the achievement in an amplified way, and that is how you can have access to the rewards.

There are things I would like to ask: You can still improve a little more. 1. I would like you to add a few more descriptive details on how to get achievements, especially on which specific biome will need to be explored to complete. 2. Could you add the possibility of using bumpers buttons to change category either all, locked, and completed? 3. Could you change the color of progress (either total progress potion and progress bar) blue to green? Because with that it looks more like you have experience (You know what I mean).

More ideas will probably come to me later.

And I think it would be all about my opinion. Keep up a good job! ;D

I think each world has to have its achievements for example I win an achievement in a world because I took wood then I don’t want to play in that world anymore I start another one takes wood then the conquest appears again
I approve of the new design of the achievement screen. Although, I think the achievements should be per world like on Java Edition.

I really love the new achievement select screen! Also I had one idea that could make it even better, what if the Music for my Ears & Change of Sheets achievements could be implemented into Minecraft Bedrock with the introduction to the new achievement screen? It’s just a thought that I had because the Music for my Ears achievement was removed when Minecraft Java had advancements implemented and have only been around as an achievement on the Legacy console editions of Minecraft along with the Change of Sheets achievement, which tied in with the release of dyed beds on those Minecraft platforms. Hopefully those achievements could be reimplemented as a parity feature between both the Console/pre 1.12 Minecraft Java!

I'd like to see maps (when viewed in main/off hand at least) show the range of X & Z coordinate. Then when I have a bunch of maps in my inventory I can more easily pick out the one for where I am in the world.

What they can do to maps is like a mark for a place.

Like if you found a gigantic cave system, you would want to go back to that cave to mine resources. Most players write the coordinates or take a screenshot, but none of those is compact. Instead they can add this feature that if you find a place, and you want go back to it in the future, you can use cartography/crafting table to make a map mark using a map and something like a quill (just like in Book and Quill).If you find my thinking interesting, then please support it. Thank you. :)
I would like to see this so at least on bedrock you won't need to have coordinates on screen at all times, you could just carry the map around.

I feel that they should put coordinates back on only the starting maps and any maps that you create. I can understand wanting to create a good challenge for the player so leaving of an explorer map or a treasure map is reasonable but I think maps that we start with and make or receive from cartography villagers (with the exception of explorer maps) have the X, Y, Z coordinates on the maps again

Yes, we NEED this! This feature is definitely the feature I missed the most after switching to Bedrock.

386648219452 Your Idea is an already existing feature ONLY on Java edition. Basically, you place a banner in the place you like, right-click it and BOOM it shows up as a marker on the map. Either way, this does not exist on Bedrock and I don't see why so plz mojong add thx.

minecraft map should make it to where are you if you push m on your keyboard it will reveal a map on youre screen plus it will give us one extra space in or slots and shows where we have been and where we have not been and if we die we do not lose the map

I personally don't understand why this is a problem, because if you had the Java Edition of Minecraft, you don't even have to buy the Windows 10 Edition. Also, even if you didn't get a Windows 10 Edition key, there's really no point in buying that version of the game unless Mojang stops supporting it, which I don't see happening for a LONG time. If you love your maps and mods so much, just stick to the Java version. It's just that simple.

I have been wanting this for a pretty long time. I play on the Switch but I think this is a function that should come with all Bedrock versions. I'm not sure how it could work but I was thinking maybe the player could somehow upload a pack/skin that will save to your Xbox Live Account. So when you're logged into that account on a console, you can download the pack/skin to your game.

Sort of like how custom skins in Windows 10 Bedrock works? Where you have one free slot to upload a custom skin to. But instead of being saved to a single device, It's saved to your account so it could be accessed anywhere.

(Bedrock console) The builds were on a super flat when they could only be three blcoks deep. It sucks not being able to see all the hardwork of these builds in this old super flat live in another world. I would hope that I am not the only one in this position. Having this feature could vastly help players in adding new life to their current builds even without being on Java.

I think this is a good idea. I honestly enjoy the soundtrack, and I find the long silence slightly annoying. It might be pretty helpful if you are working on a resource pack with custom music too.

Yes I agree 100% Playing Minecraft in dead silence for 20 min intervals is no fun. Players should at least have an option for the music. Coming from console edition where the songs played back to back, bedrock feels dead silent. I cannot speak on behalf of Java, but i believe non of the editions did it as good as console. Back to back music or at least and option for it would go a long ways in improving the dead silence of Minecraft.
So agree! I've tried just externally playing a loop of minecraft music, but it doesn't match the ambiance like the in game music.

It always annoys me when there's a super long silence while playing Minecraft. As someone who doesn't play games very frequently and not for a long time it really stresses me out. Would absolutely love this.

The problem is authorization: if you had a loading folder on the SD card, it would create a security problem for the entire system, because people could load custom software that could damage the OS by interfacing with other applications or by downloading other software like an IP Grabber. Yes, it could be possible for having maybe an authorization platform on Minecraft.net but it would create an hassle to Nintendo to make a secure "tunnel" for loading files from the SD card to the internal storage, by granting security to the OS... still an idea that i would love to see in action for everyone.

Irrelevant. Firstly, Notch is not a part of the team now so his contribution past selling the game ended and secondly "Not on Steam!!!" is not offensive.

"Not on Steam!!!" simply states that the game is not on steam which is an unoffensive and true statement.

"Not on Steam!!!" is just a fact. Also, it was a splash added in Indev. Notch knows about it. So does valve, as the Top Notch item was added after Indev. The item was added in Nov. 2011. You might want to do a little more research before you post on the feedback forum. It's a bad sign when one person can dispute your argument in 2 Google searches.
These splash messages are made in a good light, they were never meant to attack any other company.

I'm sorry...? How is this proper feedback? This has nothing to do with the gameplay. Next you're going to say the "also try" splashes are offensive. May I point out the environment of steam at the time and the decision to self publish being a risky move? This little jab was a joke and not offensive to Valve or Steam, in fact, I'm pretty sure it was an effective move to introduce new PC players to give steam a go. We've seen splashes leave rotation, like holidays involving notch and his girlfriend at the time, but "rude" splashes that poke fun add to the variety.

More details and my take on it!

NVIDIA GeForce Now is a cloud-gaming platform that allows people to play games they would not normally be able to run on their computers.

Since Minecraft has worked with NVIDIA before on 'Minecraft with RTX for Windows 10' you could opt-in to join that platform! It will allow players from around the world to appreciate all the work put into the RTX!

People would not need a "supercomputer" to stare in awe at the amazing new lighting system! 

More players means more popularity, which means more success!

I was under the impression that the game would keep track of Time Since Last Slept in the statistics, meaning a form of this idea is already in the game. Can anyone confirm?

That would be a somewhat out of the way place to look for information about how soon you are going to be attacked by a dangerous mob.  Plus, if the statistics page exists in bedrock, I don’t know how to find it.

At the very least, I would suggest having an insomnia status effect appear once you have been awake too long so that you get more warning than being attacked.  (If this already exists, I apologize.  I am a bedrock player and so have not experienced the phantoms first hand)

Just checked; there is indeed a statistic in Java Edition that keeps track of how long it's been since you last slept. Perhaps parity in this area is the real question here?

I dislike the idea of a status effect because status effects have always affected that player, not another mob's spawning mechanics. So it would be an anomaly.

I honestly like the current way things are. From the gameplay I have seen, you will generally hear the phantoms' screeches several seconds before you are actually attacked. I feel that that is warning enough for anyone inattentive enough to go without sleep for that long :)

I already knew time slept since last sleep stats existed in Java. But for Bedrock thats a different story. I dont see an option like that on Bedrock edition. That can be a problem if we suggest someone logs on to their world the first time in a while. How will he know if he needs to sleep or not if he's far away from his bed.

I agree that a status effect is a little odd, but it is a named condition of the player that causes the phantoms to spawn, so in that context it makes sense.  I also suggested the status effect as a minimum warning.  If it's possible to have a countdown to insomnia somewhere easy to check and not too intrusive, that would be ideal.

As to the screech being ample warning, not everyone plays with sounds on.  I have also witnessed multiple surprise phantom attacks on people playing in snapshots.  Most of the time it's "what's that odd noise" followed by very quick death.  It might be different once people are more experienced with the mobs and know what actions will and will not protect them, but they are still strong mobs that attack rather quickly once they appear.
On Minecraft Bedrock please add this feature because this would be helpful in knowing when we need to go to bed to prevent being attacked.
With this, the idea for COFFEE(Cocoa Tea) fits so much better!

This is a wonderful idea, but there are already a few other statistics that don't have meters, for example saturation and regional difficulty. Regional difficulty in particular can be found on the debug screen (F3).
If there isn't already, maybe add it as a scoreboard objective so that servers could customly display it as they like... and as default, it is shown in TAB (Player list) or something

A visual representation of this similar to when you're near a world border would be a good approach to this and could improve the gameplay a lot.

Because it is just annoying when you f.e. build a house or something, listen to some music (and maybe even have sounds disabled or made more silent) and suddenly you get attacked by a Phantom and fall down the building and maybe even die from fall damage (happened to me once). This is frustrating and a visual indicator on screen could, in fact, let you know that Phantoms could spawn and attack you and that you should sleep.

Also, Phantoms are more of an annoyance rather than an actual thread since you can clearly see how this is Mojang's first flying mob that respects collision other than... "other" mobs *cough* Enderdragon *cough*. Sorry Mojang, but the Phantom actually quite sucks.
This could be a great feature if it goes with phantoms. For example if your meter is too high you would start to see phantoms.

I swear, this needs to exist - but not by the health and hunger bars. It should be visible above the E inventory menu.

If it should still go in the normal UI, just put it above the hunger.

I like this idea as it can be exceptionaly difficult while playing on a realm or server and getting all players in a bed to sleep. The status affect is, in my opinion, not the best way to display this. As stated it is traditionally used to dislpay affects on the player. Yes I know, insomnia is a player specific affect. I think a great solution would be to have a phantom appear behind the player in your inventory GUI. The more visable the phantom is, the greater your insomnia. I also like the idea suggested for Coffee, we could really use this on a server and realm. Coffee could reduce your insomnia but not make it disapear completely. Also the Coffee would have limited affectiveness the more you consume until it become neccesary for you to sleep.

The closest statistic to insomnia currently is "Time Since Last Rest" and phantoms spawn after 3 (minecraft) days, or 1 (real life) hour. 

 

It looks like this:

Pulling up a statistics page isn't practical for something like this. If you want to know the number of blocks you've walked, or the number of creepers you've slain, sure, but this is something with a practical gameplay application. I don't want to go into the escape screen every time I forget whether I've slept recently. I do agree with obv10u3 that it probably shouldn't be on the main HUD. It would be easy for that to get cluttered. The inventory screen would probably be fine, or maybe there could be another key you press to bring up additional measurements. For example, as long as you're holding "M," you can see your saturation, how long since you've slept, and... Various other stuff that I can't think of right now. XD

Players should be able to sleep at any time whenever this sleep meter is low. Sleeping would replenish this bar, and when it is full or when the player chooses they will wake up. This would allow the player to choose to skip certain times of the day. How tired the player is determines how much time can be skipped
Very good suggestion! I hate it when Phantoms just suddenly swoop down after I've been in the mines all day and don't know if they will appear. You got my vote.
